instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message: well here we have one with a weird ass issue. after a few seconds of powering on, it shuts down. whenever its in boot selection menu, recovery, diagnostics, or booting to mac os. if i remove trackpad flex, then it works just fine, but obviously no trackpad or keyboard. i tried another know good whole topcase and bottomcase assembly and still same issue. i tried flashing a clean me bios, and still the same issue. so where should i go from this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message:
Disconnect KB and let TP connected.
Let see what happens.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message: still does the same thing. heck, now its worse, when i short pin 5 of the keyboard to ground, i notice is turned on because i have click on the trackpad but then shuts down, whitout even givin me a image. basically no change

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message: how do i start in smc bypass?, perhaps is some sensor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut down after a few seconds of powering on.
threads.message:
Short story, press power button, connect charger, maintain pressing the button 5-10s.
But you lost 2 hours to get a reply, instead of getting it in 5 min using search function on the forum.
BTW, use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads instead of button.
Also post <SIGNAL>SM_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> level w/ and w/o KB connected.
